TEXT: The applicants , born in DATE and DATE respectively , are NORP nationals who are living in GPE . The first applicant is the father ( PERSON ) of the second applicant ( PERSON ) .
The facts of the case , as presented by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE PERSON was arrested by policemen and taken to ORG . He was charged with disseminating illegal propaganda for the ORG .

He was placed in custody to be questioned by policemen . He alleged that he was hosed with pressurised water , that electric shocks were administered to his body and was prevented from sleeping . He was subsequently requested to give information and to admit the charges .
On the same day policemen from ORG searched the applicants’ house with the consent of ORG wife and on the orders of the principal public prosecutor at ORG .
On DATE a doctor at ORG examined ORG medical report was prepared , which stated that he bore no trace of illtreatment and that he was fit . He was then released .

On DATE the principal public prosecutor at ORG issued a decision of non - prosecution in relation to PERSON The public prosecutor considered that he had not been involved in the ORG and that his acts did not constitute the offence of illegal propaganda .

On DATE the applicants filed a petition with the NORP public prosecutor ’s office . They complained that the policemen had unlawfully searched their house . PERSON further complained that the policemen had tortured him during his detention in custody .

On DATE the NORP public prosecutor issued a decision of non - prosecution in relation to the policemen at ORG . He considered that there was insufficient evidence on which to institute criminal proceedings against the policemen .
On DATE the applicants filed an objection with ORG against the LOC public prosecutor ’s decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ objection . The court stated , inter alia , that

“ ... the complainants PERSON and PERSON complained that the latter had been tortured during his detention in police custody . However , the medical reports of CARDINAL and DATE , prepared by Dr. PERSON from ORG , stated that PERSON bore no trace of ill - treatment and that he was fit .

In his petition of DATE PERSON further complained that his house had been searched by use of force ... It has been understood that the house search report of DATE bore the signature of his wife PERSON Erdagöz who had consented to the search of her house . It follows that the decision of non - prosecution is lawful and the objection should be rejected .... ”
